subject_terms_3: Portrait photography Women Peranakan costumes Children
physical_appearance: The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features a lady and  female child. The lady is sitting down while the child is standing to her left. Both of them are wearing their ethnic costumes and have their hairs tied back. The girl adorns a necklace as well.
sgcool_label_text:
This studio portrait shows a seated nyonya and a girl wearing a necklace. The studio mark of J. B. Jasper is stamped on the back of the photograph. 

Studios were already established across the Strait Settlements and the Dutch East Indies by the 1840s and became increasingly prevalent in the 1850s. During the 1920s, Chinese-owned studios dominated the studio photography trade in Southeast Asia.
title_text: Studio portrait of a seated nyonya and a girl
